channel.title: [Website Help] Written Tutorial
channel.description:
Hello, welcome to my first tutorial on moparscape. To help you with making a website. [Read Below] [Code] [General Website Layout][Start] [General Website Layout][End] [If you use the template, skip step 1-4] Starting with HTML: [NEED TO START WITH THIS] Need to start with "" or you can use Then use "" to start website and " to end website Use "" and "" "" To start a title, and "" to end "
" for a long line across the screen "" to start the main things, such as text. And "" to end "" "

" To start a paragraph and "

to end it "" to start bold text and " to end it "" to start italic text and "" to end it "" to start a link and "" to end it [NOT FINISHED!] [Read Below] "" and "" to end it [Must use full link! "http://websitename.com"] To make a new page for your website, copy the content on the current slide and make a new document and paste it. [Not finished! Read Below!] After that, save as: second page or whatever and save it as a "html" If you want a link from your 1st page to your second then type "What you want it to say" To add a link to the same webpage you will have to go to the place you want to link and add "" After that goto the top of the page and do "Text you want to use" [You can do this as many times as you like] To add a link to an email adress you will have to "Text you want it to say" "Text that will show on your webpage" [This will be what it will say when you hover over a link] To add an image you will have to: Find an image, find out what the image name is and copy it into your website folder. [Not finished! Keep going!] Then type: "" To turn it into a link you will have to add the "" at the start and "" at the end To resize an image just simply put it on the website, "" [Not the smaller the images, the faster the website. Easier if you make the images smaller using photoshop, etc.] To make a table you will have to start with "" and end with "
" Everything inbetween this will be your table, to make more rows. Use "" and to make a collum, use "" [No Data = No table] The more rows, the more "" you will need. To add a border use "" For table headers, use "" [This needs to be in the table rows!] To change how many collums the header takes up, you will need to type "" [Needs a {Table Row) for itself!] And changing the table width, you will need to type "
TextText
" or you can give it a percentage. So you can have "
" [Either way is good] You can change the space between the text and border by putting, "
" to start and "" to end To add something to your list you will need to type: "
  • " to start and "
  • " to end[Un-Orderd List] To make an orderd list you will need to type "
      " to start and "
    " to end Same rules accure with "
  • " to start the list of items and "
    • " to end Starting with CSS: "" to end it Between the two brackets you will now need to add "p {colour:blue;}" you can also add "p {colour:blue};font-family:arial}" To make it look better you can seperate the rules, do this by doing "p {colour:blue; font-family:arial; } RGB Colours are found on Photoshop colour picker or on websites. If you use RGB, you will need to do "h1/p/whatever {colour:#RGB Number;} To change the width of your paragraphs, you will need to type: "p {line-height:Percentage%;}" [This will be inbetween "" [125-130% is good] Best way to make text bold is by doing it through CSS "p/ul/ol or whatever {front-weight:bold;} [This is between ""] Best way to change the font to italic is through CSS "p/ul/ol or whatever {font-style:italic;) [Also between ""] To change where the title is placed you will have to type: "h3/h4/h5 or whatever {text-align:center;} [You can also use " To indent a paragraph you will have to use "p {text-indent:"Number of Pixels/Percentage"} To change the overall Font/Font Colour/Background Image or Background Colour, you will need to "Body { background-colour:colour you want; [Background Colour] colour:colour you want; [Font Colour] font:font you want [Font] background-image:url(FileName); [Background Image] background-repeat:no-repeat; [To have one big Background Image] background-repeat:repeat-x; [Repeat Longways] background-repeat:repeat-y; [Repeat Up and Down] background-position: "Size from Left hand size" "How far down" [Image in a certain position] background-position: 50% 50% [To center the picture] } To change the padding, you will need to type inbetween "style," "h1/h2/h3/h4 or whatever h1/h2/h3 or whatever {background-colour:colour; padding:Number of Pixels; [All Directions] padding-top:Number of Pixels; [Top] padding-bottom:Number of Pixels; [Bottom] padding-left:Number of Pixels; [Left] padding-right:Number of Pixels; [Right] { To change the border using CSS, you will need to type this inbetween "" border-colour:colour; [Colour] border-width:Number of Pixels; [Width] border-style:dashed [Border Pattern][there are a lot more borders, search for them online!] { To change the margin of everything on your webpage! You will need a background colour and you will need to type: margin:Number of Pixels; } [/Code] AND NOW YOU ARE ABOUT READY TO MAKE YOUR PERFECT WEBSITE! Hope you enjoyed. Made by Tommy! Youtube: www.youtube.com/Tommzify With help from: www.youtube.com/TheNewBoston Thanks for viewing. And again, enjoy!

item.title: [Website Help] Written Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Love how the whole thing is surrounded in code tags, it’s a pleasure to read

Read full topic

item.title: [Website Help] Written Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“TommyGP, post:7, topic:470793”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=588273.msg4172085#msg4172085 date=1354489746]
It kind of made me vomit a little. I didn’t bother reading all the way through because I know more then the basics, and well, it’s design was bad. Use [code ] tags when you demonstrate code. And get rid of the [] in front of every new line…
3/10.
[/quote]
There, hopefully that is better.[/quote]
No offence but no.
You put the whole tutorial in code tags.
I said only throw the code in it.
You don’t need to declare if you have a <!DOCTYPE> declared…
I’m sure there’s more problems, I hadn’t read it all yet.
Get rid of all that tabbing and stuff. It’s a tutorial. You’re conventions don’t matter when describing what each tag/code does.

Read full topic

item.title: [Website Help] Written Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

This is terribly laid out, I love it when people write tutorials but at least make it look neat. You also skip past quite a lot of detail in certain aspects such as selectors in CSS and just general tardiness in code. Try working on the layout a bit and then I’ll point out where you could have went better with the code

Read full topic

item.title: [Website Help] Written Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @TommyGP TommyGP
item.description:
@TommyGP wrote:

Host Gushers:

Nice tutorial…It would be better if u just made a video…Better for the people who dont like to read. (me)

Yeah, I know but with videos you have to stop and start.
Just thought it would be a change.
And thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: [Website Help] Written Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @TommyGP TommyGP
item.description:
@TommyGP wrote:

Hello, welcome to my first tutorial on moparscape.
To help you with making a website.
[Read Below]

[General Website Layout][Start]
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C/DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitionsal..dtd">

<html>
<head>

</head>


<body>


</body>
</html>
[General Website Layout][End]

[If you use the template, skip step 1-4]
Starting with HTML:
[NEED TO START WITH THIS] Need to start with "<!doctype html>" or you can use <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C/DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitionsal..dtd">
Then use "<html>" to start website and "</html> to end website
Use "<head>" and "</head>"
"<title>" To start a title, and "</title>" to end
"<hr />" for a long line across the screen
"<body>" to start the main things, such as text. And "</body>" to end
"<!--" To see things on document but not website "-->"
"<p>" To start a paragraph and "</p> to end it
"<strong>" to start bold text and "</strong> to end it
"<em>" to start italic text and "</em>" to end it
"<a>" to start a link and "</a>" to end it [NOT FINISHED!] [Read Below]
"<a href="Link">" and "</a>" to end it [Must use full link! "http://websitename.com"]
To make a new page for your website, copy the content on the current slide and make a new document and paste it. [Not finished! Read Below!]
After that, save as: second page or whatever and save it as a "html"
If you want a link from your 1st page to your second then type "<a href="Page Name">What you want it to say</a>"
To add a link to the same webpage you will have to go to the place you want to link and add "<a name="link you will use"></a>"
After that goto the top of the page and do "<a href="#name">Text you want to use</a>" [You can do this as many times as you like]
To add a link to an email adress you will have to "<a href="mailto:email">Text you want it to say</a>"
"<a href="Website" title="Text">Text that will show on your webpage</a>" [This will be what it will say when you hover over a link]
To add an image you will have to: Find an image, find out what the image name is and copy it into your website folder. [Not finished! Keep going!]
Then type: "<img src="File Name.jpg/etc"/>"
To turn it into a link you will have to add the "<a href="Where you want to link it to">" at the start and "</a>" at the end
To resize an image just simply put it on the website, "<img src="Picture Name.Whatever" height="Size you want"/>" [Not the smaller the images, the faster the website. Easier if you make the images smaller using photoshop, etc.]
To make a table you will have to start with "<table>" and end with "</table>"
Everything inbetween this will be your table, to make more rows. Use "<tr></tr>" and to make a collum, use "<td></td>" [No Data = No table]
The more rows, the more "<td></td>" you will need.
To add a border use "<table border="Size of border you want">"
For table headers, use "<th>Text</th>" [This needs to be in the table rows!]
To change how many collums the header takes up, you will need to type "<th colspan="How many rows you want it to take up">Text</th>" [Needs a <tr> {Table Row) for itself!]
And changing the table width, you will need to type "<table border="If you want" width="How ever many pixels">" or you can give it a percentage. So you can have "<table border="If you want it" width=100%">" [Either way is good]
You can change the space between the text and border by putting, "<table border="If needed" cellpadding="Distance you want between text and border" [Not needed, just for making it look better]
You can also change the cells themselfs, "<table border="If you want it" cellspacing="Distance between cells" [Not needed, I would not recomend]
To add lists, you will need to type: "<ul>" to start and "</ul>" to end
To add something to your list you will need to type: "<li>" to start and "<li>" to end[Un-Orderd List]
To make an orderd list you will need to type "<ol>" to start and "</ol>" to end
Same rules accure with "<li>" to start the list of items and "</li>" to end

Starting with CSS:
"<style type="text/css">" to start the website look sexy! "</style>" to end it
Between the two brackets you will now need to add "p {colour:blue;}" you can also add "p {colour:blue};font-family:arial}"
To make it look better you can seperate the rules, do this by doing "p {colour:blue;
                                                                           font-family:arial;
																		   }
RGB Colours are found on Photoshop colour picker or on websites. If you use RGB, you will need to do "h1/p/whatever {colour:#RGB Number;}
To change the width of your paragraphs, you will need to type: "p {line-height:Percentage%;}" [This will be inbetween "<style type="text/css">" and "</style>" [125-130% is good]
Best way to make text bold is by doing it through CSS "p/ul/ol or whatever {front-weight:bold;} [This is between "<style type="text/css">" and "</style>"]
Best way to change the font to italic is through CSS "p/ul/ol or whatever {font-style:italic;) [Also between "<style type="text/css">" and "</style>"]
To change where the title is placed you will have to type: "h3/h4/h5 or whatever {text-align:center;} [You can also use "
To indent a paragraph you will have to use "p {text-indent:"Number of Pixels/Percentage"}
To change the overall Font/Font Colour/Background Image or Background Colour, you will need to "Body {
																					background-colour:colour you want; [Background Colour]
																					colour:colour you want; [Font Colour]
																					font:font you want [Font]
																					background-image:url(FileName); [Background Image]
																					background-repeat:no-repeat; [To have one big Background Image]
																					background-repeat:repeat-x; [Repeat Longways]
																					background-repeat:repeat-y; [Repeat Up and Down]
																					background-position: "Size from Left hand size" "How far down" [Image in a certain position]
																					background-position: 50% 50% [To center the picture]
																					}
To change the padding, you will need to type inbetween "style," "h1/h2/h3/h4 or whatever     h1/h2/h3 or whatever {background-colour:colour;
																													  padding:Number of Pixels; [All Directions]
																													  padding-top:Number of Pixels; [Top]
																													  padding-bottom:Number of Pixels; [Bottom]
																								                      padding-left:Number of Pixels; [Left]
																								                      padding-right:Number of Pixels; [Right]
																								                      {
To change the border using CSS, you will need to type this inbetween "<style>" and "</style>"    border-colour:colour; [Colour]
																									border-width:Number of Pixels; [Width]
																									border-style:dashed [Border Pattern][there are a lot more borders, search for them online!]
																									{
To change the margin of everything on your webpage! You will need a background colour and you will need to type: margin:Number of Pixels; }

AND NOW YOU ARE ABOUT READY TO MAKE YOUR PERFECT WEBSITE!
Hope you enjoyed.
Made by Tommy!
Youtube: www.youtube.com/Tommzify
With help from: www.youtube.com/TheNewBoston
Thanks for viewing.
And again, enjoy!

Read full topic
